page.title: 16LAW AND ORDER IN WELSHPOOL
page.content: {The Welshpool Police Station}is situated on the outskirts of the town, near the railway station. There are 35 officers stationed there together with four special constables and one traffic warden. The officers work in shifts from 6am-2pm, 2pm-10pm,and 10pm-6am, but rural officers who visit local villages work from either 5pm-1am or 9am-5pm. The station has three patrol cars but they can borrow more from Newtown if required. The police visit schools teaching road safety and also help local horse owners about how to use the roads properly. The most common crimes in the area are petty thefts and motoring offences. {The local court in Welshpool}deals with these offences and sits weekly with three judges in attendance.
